content.title: SITARE-Gandhian Young Technological Innovation Award Grant
content.details: The SITARE-Gandhian Young Technological Innovation Award Grant (SITARE-GYTI) is part of the SITARE scheme initiated by the Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) to support innovative student projects in biotechnology. The scheme aims to promote translational research and the development of biotech startups.
benefits: Funding support of up to INR 15 lakhs per project
Continuous mentoring support including technical, IP, legal, networking, and business mentoring
eligibility: Indian student pursuing a Ph.D/Masters in any discipline
Valid ID issued by the Institution/University
No Objection Certificate (NoC) as per prescribed format
Only one SITARE-GYTI Award Grant per student
content.application_process: Online submission during an active Call for Proposals, which occurs once a year typically in August/September.
documents_required: Valid ID issued by the Institution/University

faqs.question: What is the 'SITARE Scheme'?
faqs.answer: The SITARE Scheme supports innovative student projects in biotechnology, promoting translational research.

faqs.question: What is the 'SITARE-GYTI'?
faqs.answer: Under SITARE-GYTI, 15 innovative student projects receive funding support of up to INR 15 lakhs each.

faqs.question: Is 'SITARE-GYTI' Award Grant a usual research fellowship?
faqs.answer: No, it is not a usual research fellowship.

faqs.question: What is the nature of support provided to beneficiaries under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Funding support in the form of grant-in-aid, milestone-based funding, and continuous mentoring.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the project?
faqs.answer: Funding is provided for a period of up to 24 months.
